meanings.definition: A long seat for several people, typically made of wood or stone.
meanings.sent1: The park had many benches for people to sit on and enjoy the sunshine.
meanings.sent2: She sat on one of the benches in the garden to read her book.
meanings.sent3: The benches in the park seemed to be chatting with each other about the weather.
meanings.sent4: The old wooden benches in the classroom held memories of generations of students.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the benches in vibrant colors, making them stand out in the park.

meanings.definition: A level area at the side of a tennis or basketball court where players and coaches sit.
meanings.sent1: The tennis players rested on the benches between matches.
meanings.sent2: The basketball coach watched the game from the benches.
meanings.sent3: The benches by the court whispered secrets of the players to each other.
meanings.sent4: The empty benches seemed to be waiting for the next game to begin.
meanings.sent5: The benches provided a comfortable spot for the tired athletes to catch their breath.

meanings.definition: To remove someone from a sports team as a punishment.
meanings.sent1: The coach decided to benches the player for breaking the team rules.
meanings.sent2: She was benched for missing too many practices.
meanings.sent3: The player felt benched but used the time to support the team from the sidelines.
meanings.sent4: Being benched motivated him to work harder to earn his spot back on the team.
meanings.sent5: The decision to bench the star player was a tough one for the coach.
